Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Morphine in Preterm Neonates Undergoing Endotracheal Tube Suctioning

Trial_Design.evidence: randomly assigned to placebo (n=449) or morphine (n=449)

Participants.evidence: Eligible participants were preterm neonates requiring mechanical ventilation.

Intervention.evidence: randomly assigned to placebo (n=449) or morphine (n=449)

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the neonatal response to ETT suctioning, assessed at 20–28 and 70–76 hours after starting the drug infusion and 10–14 hours after discontinuation.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, with concealed allocation.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding included outcome assessors, patients, and clinicians.

Number_Randomised.evidence: randomly assigned to placebo (n=449) or morphine (n=449)

Result_Outcome.evidence: No significant relationship was observed between morphine concentrations and heart rate changes or the Premature Infant Pain Profile.
